title.narrative: FY 20 OES South Pacific Tuna Treaty and Economic Assistance Agreement

description.narrative: To support economic development related to environmental purposes, including sustainable fishing activities, fisheries management, increased economic returns from fisheries, and fisheries development projects in the Pacific Island region.

activity-date.narrative: Date unavailable. Calculated start date is the earliest transaction date

Biosphere protection

transaction.usg:treasury-account: Economic Support Fund

title.narrative: Preservation of Traditional Knowledge and Ancient Crafts in the Solomon Islands

description.narrative: Over centuries, Polynesians and other oceanic peoples have developed elaborate inter-island voyaging networks and techniques. This project, which includes the documentation of traditional TepPuke voyaging knowledge unique to the Solomon Islands, directly supports the U.S. embassys efforts to assist island communities with the preservation of their unique heritage.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Environment - General
Site preservation

title.narrative: Strengthening coordinated efforts to combat Trafficking in Persons in the Solomon Islands

description.narrative: IOM is supporting the establishment and institutionalization of a national referral mechanism and enhancing victim protection in the Solomon Islands. Expected project outcomes are: (1) key government and civil society stakeholders are active and credible participants in the national coordination body for counter-trafficking; (2) national law enforcement actors effectively investigate and prosecute perpetrators of trafficking in persons; and (3) identified victims of trafficking receive consistent, high quality support through a well-coordinated network of government and civil society service providers.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

sector.narrative: Transnational Crime
Human rights

title.narrative: A Comprehensive Response to Prevent and Combat Trafficking in Persons in the Solomon Islands

description.narrative: The American Bar Association Fund for Justice and Education (ABA), with J/TIP's support, has been operating in the Solomon Islands since 2010. ABA works with civil society, government, and law enforcement to generate a comprehensive response to prevent trafficking in persons (TIP), and to strengthen efforts to protect survivors and prosecute violators. The goal of the project is to reduce the prevalence of trafficking in the Solomon Islands and to develop an effective, coordinated response to the problem. To this end, the program has four objectives: 1.) strengthen data collection among legal service providers and law enforcement for reporting, referrals, and prosecution; 2.) build awareness of TIP among vulnerable communities, government, and legal service providers; 3.) enhance legal services and counseling for trafficking survivors; and 4.) strengthen regional sharing of information.

person-name.narrative: Jenee Sharon; Wes Aviles; Ryan Boles

Human rights
